creator: hrosa@digitalis.pt
text:
When we use mod_jk to attach Apache with JBoss in a single port number we get a
strange behaviour.

If we access a JSP file directly all works fine. The JSP gets compiled and
properly executed. The result is of the indicated content type, i.e. "TEXT/HTML".
If the same JSP file get invoked through a servlet in a normal MVC application
then the content type gets rewritten from the JSP result "TEXT/HTML" to
"TEXT/PLAIN".
When we access this page with Internet Explorer the pages are interpreted as a
HTML page since it ignores the HTTP header and reads the META DATA in the HTML
content.
Firefox and other more "pure" or restricted browsers as they get a HTTP Header
with "TEXT/PLAIN" render the page as simple text and display the page's source
code on screen.

Anybody has this problem?
Ideias for a workarround?
We have a site in production with this problem so any help will be greatly
appreciated.
